Uttarakhand became the first state in the country to implement a Uniform Civil Code (UCC). It enacted the UCC under the legislative powers of concurrent list having subjects of marriage, adoption and succession. About UCC: y UCC refers to codification of personal laws of various communities which apply to all citizens equally regardless of their religion, caste, community etc. y Currently, personal laws of various communities are governed by their religious scriptures. y Article 44 of the Indian constitution provides for enabling provision of Uniform Civil Code in India....

About the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association: y The Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA) is one of the oldest established organizations in the Commonwealth, founded in 1911. y It is a membership association which brings together Members, irrespective of gender, race, religion or culture, who are united by community of interest, respect for the rule of law and individual rights and freedoms, and by the pursuit of the positive ideals of parliamentary democracy. y The Association is made up of over 180 Legislatures (or Branches) divided up between nine geographic regions of the Commonwealth. y It offers a vast opportunity for Parliamentarians and parliamentary staff to collaborate on issues of mutual interest and to share good practice....
